column4: al. he was a lifelong resident of mobile
column5: al and worked for scott paper company for 38 years. he was a deacon at white stone missionary baptist church. he leaves to cherish his memories
column16: jason (la. tara) taylor and elton (mignon) chambers; three sisters; one brother; a host of nieces
column18: grandchildren and friends. his remains will lie in state on friday
column20: 2015 from 1pm until 8pm at smalls mortuary mobile
column21: al. visitation will be held on saturday
column23: 2015 from 9am until the 11am funeral hour at white stone missionary baptist church 1015 mobile st. mobile
column24: al. interment will follow in gethsemane cemetery
column26: al. dignified and professional services entrusted to small s mortuary 950 south broad st. mobile
